page.title: 06PENRITH AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: Daily instructions from Carlisle.19 people employed full-time,including ambulance drivers.An{ambulance driver} must be 21 years old,& takes a 6 week {training}in medical techniques as well as driving training.Drivers normally work an 8 hour shift,as the{station}is open 24 hours a day .The station has 7 standard{ambulances}and 1{emergency {control vehicle.}A basic vehicle costs {Â£14000}plus{Â£7000}equipment. Standard {equipment}includes stretcher trolleys and bedding, resuscitation apparatus, maternity packs, rescue equipment, oxygen masks,and various dressings and splints.{Work:}20% is emergency calls at rate of 40-80 per month.80%hospital admissions, transport of elderly to day centres.{1000}patients per month. Station working radius 30 miles from Penrith,also routine journeys to New- castle for kidney dialysis - 140 miles
